lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ip.main.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ip.main.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
# User Guide of Charlie, a Task-managing Chatbot
1. Ensure you have Java 11 installed in your Computer.
3. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the
`java -jar ip.jar` command to run the application.
4. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
> For the command format, words in UPPER_CASE are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
Adds a task of 'todo' type to the list of tasks.
`todo read book` assuming list is currently empty
Adds a task of 'deadline' type to the list of tasks.
Adds a task of 'event' type to the list of tasks.
### Un-marking a task as not completed: `unmark`
Data are saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that changes the data.
There is no need to save manually.
* Contains the entry point of the chatbot program
private static Ui ui = new Ui();
private static Parser parser = new Parser();
private static TaskList tasks = new TaskList(ui);
* The entry point of the application.
* The bot introduces itself and loads previously stored data
* before the user can start giving instructions
* Repeatedly reads in the user's input and execute the commands
* given, updating the data file when needed.
ui.printWithoutLeadingSpace("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Deals with making sense of the user command
* Identifies the type of command from the input and executes the command.
* Reminds the user when the input is invalid.
* Returns to the caller whether the data file needs to be updated
* @param ui the user interface interacting with the user
* @return whether the data file needs to be updated
public boolean parseInput(String line, Ui ui, TaskList tasks) {
ui.print("Possible commands: bye, list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event");
* Deals with loading tasks from the data file and saving tasks in the file
* Constructor to initialise the file and ui attributes.
* If the data file or the directory does not exist in the
* hard disk yet, they will be created
* @param filePath relative file path of the data file
* @param ui the user interface interacting with the user
* @throws IOException if unable to create data file
public Storage(String filePath, Ui ui) throws IOException {
* Loads in all the stored tasks in the data file
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the data file does not exist
public void readStoredData(TaskList tasks) throws FileNotFoundException {
ui.printWithoutLeadingSpace("I have no idea what this is: " + str);
* Writes the tasks into the data file
* Constructor to initialise the tasks and ui attributes
* @param ui the user interface interacting with the user
* Returns the size of the task list
* @return the number of tasks in the list
* Adds a new task to the task list
* @param task the new task to be added to the list
* Prints the entire list of tasks, including details of
* the task type, whether it is done, and the description
ui.print("Here is your list of tasks:");
ui.print("Here are the tasks containing '" + keyword + "':");
* Processes the user's input to identify the index that
* needs to be marked as completed and marks the task
* @return whether a task has been successfully marked
ui.print("Please provide a number from 1 to " + tasks.size());
ui.print("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Processes the user's input to identify the index that
* needs to be unmarked as not completed and unmarks the task
* @return whether a task has been successfully unmarked
ui.print("Please provide a number from 1 to " + tasks.size());
ui.print("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Processes the user's input to identify the index that
* needs to be deleted and removes the task
* @return whether the task has been successfully deleted
ui.print("Please provide a number from 1 to " + tasks.size());
* Adds a Todo to the list of tasks
* @return whether the Todo has been successfully added
* Adds a Deadline to the list of tasks
* @return whether the Deadline has been successfully added
* Adds an Event to the list of tasks
* @return whether the Event has been successfully added
* Deals with interactions with the user
* The bot introduces itself to the user and prompts for input
printWithoutLeadingSpace("What can I do for you?");
* Prints a String without leading space and with a newline at the end
* Prints a String with leading space and with a newline at the end
* Returns the user's input, with leading and trailing spaces trimmed
* A subclass of the Task class. Contains the additional information
* of when the deadline is by
* Constructor to process the user's input and call the constructor of the
* superclass with the appropriate information of the task's description passed.
* Also extracts from the user's input when the deadline is by
* and assigns to the by attribute
* Overloaded constructor that takes in the information needed for the object's
* attributes directly instead of the user's input.
* Calls the constructor of the superclass with the description passed
* and assigns the isDone and by attributes
* @param isDone whether the deadline task is done
* @param description the description of the deadline
* @param by when the deadline is by
public Deadline(boolean isDone, String description, String by) {
* Returns a formatted String containing the icon that represents the
* task type (Deadline), the status icon, and the description of the task
* @return a String specifying the object is a Deadline, if it is done, and its description
* A subclass of the Task class. Contains the additional information
* of when the event is from and to
* Constructor to process the user's input and call the constructor of the
* superclass with the appropriate information of the task's description passed.
* Also extracts from the user's input when the event is from and to
* and assigns to the respective attributes
* Overloaded constructor that takes in the information needed for the object's
* attributes directly instead of the user's input.
* Calls the constructor of the superclass with the description passed
* and assigns the isDone, from, and to attributes
* @param isDone whether the event is done
* @param description the description of the event
* @param from when the event is from
* @param to when the event is to
public Event(boolean isDone, String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a formatted String containing the icon that represents the
* task type (Event), the status icon, and the description of the task
* @return a String specifying the object is an Event, if it is done, and its description
* Represents a task, containing the description of the task
* and whether the task has been marked as completed
* Constructor to initialise the object's description as the description argument
* and the object's isDone as false
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns "X" if the task is completed and returns " " otherwise
* @return a character representing whether the task is done
* Returns a formatted String containing the status icon
* and the description of the task
* @return a String specifying if the task is done and its description
* A subclass of the Task class. Does not contain additional information
* Constructor to process the user's input and call the constructor of the
* superclass with the appropriate information of the task's description passed
* Overloaded constructor that takes in the description
* and whether the todo is done directly instead of the user's input.
* Calls the constructor of the superclass with the description passed
* @param isDone whether the todo is done
* @param description the description of the todo
* Returns a formatted String containing the icon that represents the
* task type (Todo), the status icon, and the description of the task
* @return a String specifying the object is a Todo, if it is done, and its description
